greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => A033879(i) = A033879(j) and A083254(i) = A083254(j), for all i, j >= 1.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of the ordered pair [A033879(n), A083254(n)], the deficiency of n, and its Möbius transform.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
example: For n=39, we have A033879(39) = 2*39 - A000203(39) = 22, and A083254(39) = 2*A000010(39)-39 = 9. For n=63 the results are same, with A033879(63) = 22 and A083254(63) = 9, thus a(39) and a(63) are allotted the same number by the restricted growth sequence transform, which in this case is 35, thus a(39) = a(63) = 35.
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 10 2019
